taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family cyperaceae;genus carex;section ovales;species tenera;variety tenera

bio:treatment.description: Leaf sheaths papillose (30X), sometimes sparsely so. Perigynium beak ascending or loosely spreading, 2.8–4 mm, exceeding pistillate scales 0–0.8 mm. 2n = 52, 54, 56.
Dry to moist, open forests and meadows;

Alta., B.C., Man., N.B., N.S., Ont., Que., Sask.; Conn., D.C., Ill., Ind., Iowa, Kans., Ky., Maine, Md., Mass., Mich., Minn., Mo., Mont., Nebr., N.H., N.J., N.Y., N.C., N.Dak., Ohio, Oreg., Pa., R.I., S.Dak., Vt., Va., W.Va., Wis., Wyo.
bio:treatment.discussion: The name Carex straminea has been incorrectly applied at times to C. tenera var. tenera.
